intro: Hieracium trebevicianum subsp. deanum, commonly known as the Dean's hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Central and Eastern Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and leaf morphology typical of the genus Hieracium. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and grasslands, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are lanceolate to ovate, with serrated margins, and it produces yellow flowers in clusters. The subspecies is distinguished by its specific geographic distribution and morphological traits that set it apart from other hawkweed species.
